gr.interamerican.bo2.utils.meta.formatters
Interface Formatter<T>

Type Parameters:
T - Type of objects represented as strings by the writer.
All Superinterfaces:
Serializable
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractNullFilteringFormatter, AbstractNullReturningFormatter, BeanCsvFormatter, BooleanFormatter, CachedEntryFormatter, CachedEntryOwnerFormatter, DateFormatter, DecimalFormatter, EnumFormatter, MoneyFormatter, MultiFormatter, NamedFormatter, NfBooleanFormatter, NfDateFormatter, NfDecimalFormatter, NfEnumFormatter, NfMoneyFormatter, NfMultiFormatter, NfNamedFormatter, NfObjectFormatter, NfTransformationBasedFormatter, NfTypedSelectableFormatter, NrBooleanFormatter, NrCachedEntryFormatter, NrCachedEntryOwnerFormatter, NrDateFormatter, NrDecimalFormatter, NrEnumFormatter, NrMoneyFormatter, NrNamedFormatter, NrObjectFormatter, NrTransformationBasedFormatter, NrTypedSelectableFormatter, NullFilteringFormatter, NullReturningFormatter, ObjectFormatter, PoKeyFormatter, Replace, ShortFormatter, TransformationBasedFormatter, TranslatableEntryFormatter, TranslatableEntryOwnerFormatter, TypedSelectableFormatter
public interface Formatter<T>
extends Serializable

A Formatter creates string representation of objects. A Writer could get the string representation of an object by the object's toString() method. However a writer is more useful in cases when a string representation of an object is necessary that is different than its toString() method.

Method Summary
 String format(T t)
          Creates a string representation of an object.
 

Method Detail

format

String format(T t)
Creates a string representation of an object.

Parameters:
t - Object that will be represented as string.
Returns:
Returns the string representation of the specified object.
